eve.core package¶

Submodules¶

eve.core.eve module¶

class eve.core.eve.Eve¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Base class for all Eve modules.

Eve is a natural extension of nn.Module.

spiking: bool¶
quantization: bool¶
obs_momentum: float¶
register_eve_parameter(name: str, param: Optional[torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]) → None¶

Adds an eve parameter to current module.

Refer to self.register_parameter() for more details.

Note

eve parameter’s name must be ended with _eve. All the parameters, whose name are not ended with _eve, will be treated as a torch parameters.

register_eve_buffer(name: str, tensor: Optional[torch.Tensor]) → None¶

Registers a eve buffer to current module.

Refer to self.register_buffer() for more details.

Note

eve buffer’s name must be ended with _eve. All the buffers, whose name are not ended with _eve, will be treated as buffer.

register_upgrade_fn(key: Any, fn: Callable) → None¶

Register a upgrade function to eve.core.eve.__global_upgrade_fn__.

The fn must be with the following signature:

>>> def upgrade_fn(param, action=None):
>>>     ...
>>>     # modified param in-place.
named_eve_parameters(prefix: str = '', recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[Tuple[str, torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s eve parameters, yielding both the name of the eve parameter as well as the eve parameter itself.

Refer to self.named_parameters() for more details.

eve_parameters(recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s eve parameters.

Refer to self.parameter() for more details.

named_torch_parameters(prefix: str = '', recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[Tuple[str, torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s torch parameters, yielding both the name of the torch parameter as well as the torch parameter itself.

Refer to self.named_parameters() for more details.

torch_parameters(recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[torch.nn.parameter.Parameter]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s torch parameters.

Refer to self.parameters() for more details.

named_eve_buffers(prefix: str = '', recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[Tuple[str, torch.Tensor]]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s eve buffers, yielding both the name of the eve buffers as well as the eve buffer itself.

Refer to self.named_buffers() for more details.

eve_buffers(recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[torch.Tensor]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s eve buffers.

Refer to self.buffers() for more details.

named_torch_buffers(prefix: str = '', recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[Tuple[str, torch.Tensor]]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s torch buffers, yielding both the name of the torch buffers as well as the torch buffer itself.

Refer to self.named_buffers() for more details.

torch_buffers(recurse: bool = True) → Iterator[torch.Tensor]¶

Returns a iterator over module’s torch buffers.

Refer to self.buffers() for more details.

spike(mode: bool = True) → eve.core.eve.Eve¶

Sets the module in spiking or non-spiking mode.

non_spike() → eve.core.eve.Eve¶
quantize(mode: bool = True) → eve.core.eve.Eve¶

Sets the module in quantizatio or non-quantization mode.

non_quantize() → eve.core.eve.Eve¶
reset(set_to_none: bool = False) → None¶

Resets eve buffers to None or zeros.

Parameters

set_to_none – instead of setting to zero, set the eve buffers to none.

requires_eve_grad_(requires_grad: bool = True) → eve.core.eve.Eve¶

The grad of eve parameters is not been used at most cases.

requires_torch_grad_(requires_grad: bool = True) → eve.core.eve.Eve¶
zero_obs(set_to_none: bool = True) → None¶

Sets observation, of all model eve parameters to zeros. See similar function under eve.Upgrader for more context.

obs(input: torch.Tensor, output: torch.Tensor)¶

The subclass of obs must have the same function signature as:

>>> def obs(cls, input: Tensor, output: Tensor):
>>>     return ...

class eve.core.layer.Dropout(p=0.5)¶

Bases: eve.core.eve.Eve

Dropout layer.

The dropout mask will not be changed among a spike trains under spiking mode.

Bases: eve.core.eve.Eve

Base class of different encoders.

Parameters

Note

class eve.core.layer.IntervalEncoder(interval_steps, timesteps)¶

Bases: eve.core.layer.Encoder

In this encoder, timesteps is only used to make sure the spiking times. the total spiking times is timesteps // interval_steps.

Useless in most cases.

eve.core.node module¶

class eve.core.node.Node¶

Bases: eve.core.eve.Eve

The base class of different spiking neuron node.

forward(dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
spiking: bool¶
quantization: bool¶
obs_momentum: float¶
training: bool¶
class eve.core.node.IFNode(state: eve.core.state.State, voltage_threshold: float = 1.0, voltage_reset: float = 0.0, learnable_threshold: bool = False, learnable_reset: bool = False, time_dependent: bool = True, neuron_wise: bool = True, surrogate_fn: str = 'Sigmoid', binary: bool = True, **kwargs)¶

Bases: eve.core.node.Node

IFNode function.

IFNode only acts in spiking mode, in non-spiking mode, it equals to nn.ReLU.

Parameters

  • state – the object contains necessary information from previous layer.

  • voltage_threshold – the voltage threshold to fire a neuron.

  • voltage_reset – the voltage to reset if fires. Set None to disable it.

  • learnbale_threshold – if True, make voltage threshold learnable.

  • learnbale_reset – if True, make voltage reset learnable.

  • time_dependent – if True, chain the membrane voltage in computing graph.

  • neuron_wise – if False, share the voltage threshold and voltage reset accross all neurons.

  • surrogate_fn (str or Callable) –

    the function used to estimate the gradient for fire operation. if str, we will look up the surrogate function from implemented approaches, if fn, we will set it directly. the surrogate fn should have the following signatures:

    >>> class surrogate_fn(Function):
>>>     @staticmethod
>>>     def forward(cls, )
NOTE: we will not check the signatures of surrogate fn.

  • binary – if True, return the value after surrogate fn (0 ro 1), otherwise, return the fired voltage by (voltage - voltage_reset).

  • kwargs – the extra arguments needed for specified surrogate function.

Note

If binary is True, we will apply the surrogate function on fired neurons’ voltage, otherwise, we will DISABLE the surrogate function and return (voltage - voltage_reset).

charging(membrane_voltage: torch.Tensor, dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
spiking_forward(dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
non_spiking_forward(dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
spiking: bool¶
quantization: bool¶
obs_momentum: float¶
training: bool¶
class eve.core.node.LIFNode(*args, tau: float = 1.0, **kwargs)¶

Bases: eve.core.node.IFNode

LIFNode function.

LIFNode only acts in spiking mode, in non-spiking mode, it equals to nn.LeakyReLU.

Parameters

  • state – the object contains necessary information from previous layer.

  • tau – membrane time constant.

  • voltage_threshold – the voltage threshold to fire a neuron. shared among all neurons.

  • voltage_reset – the voltage to reset if fires. Set None to disable it.

  • learnbale_threshold – if True, make voltage threshold learnable.

  • learnbale_reset – if True, make voltage reset learnable.

  • time_dependent – if True, chain the membrane voltage in computing graph.

  • neuron_wise – if False, share the voltage threshold and voltage reset accross all neurons.

  • surrogate_fn (str or Callable) –

    the function used to estimate the gradient for fire operation. if str, we will look up the surrogate function from implemented approaches, if fn, we will set it directly. the surrogate fn should have the following signatures:

    >>> class surrogate_fn(Function):
>>>     @staticmethod
>>>     def forward(cls, )
NOTE: we will not check the signatures of surrogate fn.

  • binary – if True, return the value after surrogate fn (0 ro 1), otherwise, return the fired voltage by (voltage - voltage_reset).

  • kwargs – the extra arguments needed for specified surrogate function.

Note

If binary is True, we will apply the surrogate function on fired neurons’ voltage, otherwise, we will DISABLE the surrogate function and return (voltage - voltage_reset).

charging(membrane_voltage: torch.Tensor, dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
non_spiking_forward(dv: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
spiking: bool¶
quantization: bool¶
obs_momentum: float¶
training: bool¶

eve.core.quan module¶

class eve.core.quan.Quan¶

Bases: eve.core.eve.Eve

state: eve.core.state.State¶
abstract quantization_forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
non_quantization_forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
forward(x: torch.Tensor) → torch.Tensor¶
class eve.core.quan.Quantizer(state: eve.core.state.State, bits: int = 8, quantize_fn: str = 'Round', range_tracker: str = 'average_tracker', average_tracker_momentum: float = 0.1, upgrade_bits: bool = False, neuron_wise: bool = False, asymmetric: bool = False, signed_quantization: bool = False, learnable_alpha: Optional[bool] = None, upgrade_fn: Optional[Callable] = None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: eve.core.quan.Quan

The base quantizer to hold different quantization function.

Parameters

  • state – the object contains necessary arguments.

  • bits – the bits/init bits of current layer.

  • quantize_fn – the quantization function used. If str, we will lookup the available quantization function, others we will use it directly.

  • range_tracker – the method to record val_min and val_max. average_tracker and glocal_tracker is supported. if callable function provided, we will use it directly.

  • average_tracker_momentum – if use average tracker, the momentum of the tracker.

  • upgrade_bits – if True, the bits can be changed all the time by upgrader.

  • neuron_wise – if False, the bits will be shared among each neurons. NOTE: if True, the observation returned is [neurons, states] formot. if Flase, the observation returned is [states] formot.

  • asymmetric – asymmetric quantization or not.

  • signed_quantization – if True, the quantization range can be negative.

  • learnable_alpha – if the alpha should be learnable. in some quantization functions, the alpha value can be updated by gradient. if the alpha can be learnable, we will not update it by tracker information.

  • upgrade_fn – the function to update eve parameter, e.i. bits in this module. if None, a directly replace operation will be used.

  • kwargs – the extra arguments to quantization function.

Note

all the eve parameters, which needed upgrader is treated as neuron wise. if learnable_alpha is enabled, the range tracker will be disabled to avoid the conflict of grad update of alpha.

state: eve.core.state.State¶

eve.core.state module¶

class eve.core.state.Statistic¶

Bases: object

Basic class to trace differetn variable state.

reset(set_to_none: bool = False)¶

reset statistic variables.

on_init(state: eve.core.state.State)¶

This function will be called at State.__init__()

on_step(state: eve.core.state.State, input: torch.Tensor, output: torch.Tensor)¶

This function will be called at State.gather_states()

class eve.core.state.State(module: eve.core.eve.Eve, apply_on: str = 'data', align_dims: Optional[List[int]] = None, param_reduce_dims: Optional[List[int]] = None, data_reduce_dims: Optional[List[int]] = None, neuron_wise: bool = False, statistic: Optional[Union[eve.core.state.Statistic, str]] = None)¶

Bases: object

A special auxiliary module to manage different data and parameter state.

Parameters

  • module – the module which used to extra state.

  • apply_on – data or param.

  • align_dims – use to align a variabl with single dimension to as many dimensions as state. if None, we will infer it from filter type.

  • param_reduce_dims – use to reduce param to singgle dimension. if None, we will infer it from filter type.

  • data_reduce_dims – use to reduce data to single dimension. if None, we will infer it from filter type.

Examples

>>> tensor = th.randn(4)
>>> tensor.reshape(align_dims)

>>> tensor = th.randn(3, 4, 5)
>>> tensor.mean(data_reduce_dims)
neuron_wise: bool¶
align_dims: List[int]¶
param_reduce_dims: List[int]¶
